cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest along the northwest Bahamas, then forecast to track north-northwest up the Florida east coast Sunday, turning north near Jacksonville early Monday and then accelerating north-northeast toward the Carolinas and the mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible coastal scrape/landfall along the east-central Florida coast between Boca Raton and the Volusia/Flagler County line

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Volusia/Flagler County Line to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast northward through Georgia and the Carolinas, extending to the mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Peak sustained winds near 30–40 kt (35–45 mph) with higher gusts possible early Monday as the center passes just offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible along the lower St. Johns River and adjacent coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain expected, locally higher in squalls
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along northeast Florida beaches
